tempestuous:
剧烈的；狂暴的；骚动的

狂风暴雨的；大风暴的 
caused by or affected by a violent storm
precedent:
先例

先前的 
preceding in time, order, or significance
paranoid:
偏执狂的，妄想症的 
of, relating to, or suffering from a mental illness that causes you to falsely believe that 
people are trying to harm you
impediment:
阻碍 
something that makes it difficult to do or complete something; something that interferes 
with movement or progress
authoritarian:
独裁的，专制的 
of, relating to, or favoring a concentration of power in a leader or an elite not 
constitutionally responsible to the people
infiltrate:
使渗入，使渗透 
(of a liquid) to permeate (something) by filtration

渗透，潜入 地方、组织中等 
to enter or gain access to (an organization, place, etc.) surreptitiously and gradually, 
especially in order to acquire secret information 
59
grievance:
委屈，不满 
a complaint or a strong feeling that you have been treated unfairly
ornate:
文体 绚丽的 
marked by elaborate rhetoric and elaborated with decorative details

装饰华丽的 
covered with decorations; covered with fancy patterns and shapes
scanty:
不足的 
very small in size or amount
intervene:
介入，干预 
to come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events

插话，打岔 
to interrupt a conversation in order to add something to it
pitfall:
隐患，意想不到的困难 
a danger or problem that is hidden or not obvious at first
malady:
疾病

固疾；弊病 
an unwholesome or disordered condition
entitle:
赋予权力 
to give a right to (someone)

命名

circumspection:
谨慎，慎重

blackout:
停电 
a period when lights are off because of an electrical power failure

新闻等的禁播，封锁，禁止出版

wriggle:
扭动 
to twist from side to side with small quick movements like a worm

耍滑不做，逃避 应做的事等 
to extricate or insinuate oneself or reach a goal as if by wriggling
denomination:
基督教教派，宗派 
a branch of the Christian Church

尤指钱的面额，面值 
a unit of value, especially of money 
60
reprimand:
谴责 
to speak in an angry and critical way to (someone who has done something wrong,

console:
安慰 
to try to make (someone) feel less sadness or disappointment

操纵台 
a flat surface that contains the controls for a machine, for a piece of electrical equipment, 
etc.
bourgeois:
中产阶级的 
relating to or belonging to the middle class of society
creed:
信条，教义 
a statement of the basic beliefs of a religion
phony:
骗人的人或东西

虚假的 
not true, real, or genuine; intended to make someone think something that is not true

戏剧、电影等的幕间休息，中间休息 
a short period of time between the parts of a play, film/movie, etc.

间歇；暂停

to exert much effort or energy, to become stretched or tense or taut

压力，重负；紧张

病菌的类型； 植物或其他有机物的系，品系，品种 
a breed, stock, or variety of an animal or plant developed by breeding

气质，特性，风格，作风 
a particular tendency as part of a person's character
quest:
探索，寻找 
an act or instance of seeking
empathy:
感同身受 
the ability to share someone else's feelings
repentant:
悔悟的，悔恨的 
expressing or feeling sincere regret and remorse; remorseful

stride:
大步走 
to walk with very long steps
sustenance:

forsake:

to give up or leave (someone or something) entirely
scrutiny:
仔细检查；认真彻底的审查

lenient:
宽大的，仁慈的

admonition:
警告；告诫

diurnal:
白昼的；白天的；日间活动的 
active mainly during the day
protract:
延长 
lengthen in time; cause to be or last longer
equitable:

just or fair; dealing fairly and equally with everyone
surreptitious:
秘密的 
done in a secret way
enzyme:
酶

progenitor:

先驱 
someone who first thinks of or does something; a person who begins something

事物的汇合，汇聚，汇集

to make (someone or something) go under the surface of water or some other liquid
nocturnal:
夜间发生的

holistic:
整体的 
relating to or concerned with complete systems rather than with individual parts
rectify:
纠正 
to correct (something that is wrong)
hostile:

of or relating to an enemy
statute:

a written law that is formally created by a government 
63

把 并置，把 并列

estrange:

competent:
有能力的，能胜任的

thwart:
阻挠，挫败 
to prevent (someone) from doing something or to stop (something) from happening

槽；饲料槽；饮水槽

a period of time when the level of something is low, especially a time when a business or

recipient:
接受者，受体

interfere:
干涉，妨碍 
to become involved in the activities and concerns of other people when your involvement is

cater_to:
迎合，满足（需求或要求）

marvel:
不可思议的事或人；奇迹

大为赞叹，惊讶不已

spurious:
假的

论据、推理 不正确的

loathe:

to hate (someone or something) very much
reminiscent:
提醒的

回忆过去的，怀旧的

骂人的话渣滓，败类
